title: 107_s2218
content: The Act may be cited as the "Kidney Disease Educational Benefits Act of 2002" and includes Medicare coverage of kidney disease education services. The "Kidney Disease Educational Benefits Act of 2002" includes Medicare coverage of kidney disease education services under Section 1861 of the Social Security Act. "Kidney Disease Education Services are covered under the "Kidney Disease Educational Benefits Act of 2002" and Medicare." The term 'kidney disease education services' refers to educational services provided to individuals with kidney disease who will require dialysis or a kidney transplant, upon referral by their physician. These services aim to offer comprehensive information on managing comorbidities, preventing uremic complications, and exploring renal replacement therapy options. The term 'qualified person' refers to healthcare professionals such as physicians, registered nurses, registered dietitians, clinical social workers, physician assistants, or nurses. These individuals play a role in providing kidney disease education services and ensuring that patients have the opportunity to actively participate in choosing their therapy options. The term 'qualified person' includes healthcare professionals like physicians, registered nurses, registered dietitians, clinical social workers, physician assistants, nurse practitioners, or clinical nurse specialists. They are involved in providing kidney disease education services and ensuring patient involvement in therapy options. The Secretary will establish requirements for personnel in renal dialysis facilities providing these services. The Secretary, in consultation with various healthcare professionals and organizations, is responsible for ensuring timely kidney disease education services for Medicare beneficiaries. Monitoring and reporting on the implementation of these services is also required. The Secretary must report to Congress on the provision of kidney disease education services to Medicare beneficiaries and make recommendations for legislative and administrative actions. Amendments are made to payment schedules for physicians and renal dialysis facilities under the Social Security Act. The amendments made under this section exclude payment for kidney disease education services from weighted formulas, instead, payments will be made to renal dialysis facilities on an assignment-related basis. These changes will apply to services provided six months after the enactment of this Act.
